area_name: Cirque of the Climbables - Left Side

climbs.name: That's Powell Not Rowell
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Kevin Powell, Mike Rodrique & Dave Evans, January 1990

content.description: Climb a right arching hand crack to a large stuck block, jam the left side of the block to exit the arete then up easy face climbing.  Hopefully the block will not fall off while you are climbing it.
content.protection: Cams 1-3" assorted small aliens for easy face above.  No fixed anchor - tie off the loose summit blocks.
content.location: This crack route is in the east alcove of the first buttress east of Treasure of the Sierra Madre.  To descend climb over to the next buttress east (exposed easy 5th class) and then walk down east near Pleasure Principal.

content.description:
A striking line up the longest buttress at the Cirque. Mostly steep face climbing on large holds, many of which are loose and crumbling. Leading this route might feel like a chossy freesolo FA.

Probably best left as a TR after climbing some of the other nearby routes. If TRing - you must build your anchor on the lowest "summit ledge", as a 60M rope will barely reach the top of the 3rd class start from here. Knot the ends!
content.protection: A few skinny slings for some really marginal knob tie-offs, and a slim standard rack. Gear anchor.
content.location: The leftmost and longest buttress at the Cirque. This route follows the prominent arÃªte through a few bulges.

content.description: Face climbing and possible ground fall before the second of two bolts add to the fun of reaching an easy finger and hand crack above.
content.protection: Two bolts and a couple small to finger size cams for the climb and medium friends for the belay.
content.location: This classic is on the south face of the corridor second buttress east of Treasure of the Sierra Madre.  Walk off east directly to the base.

content.description: Climb the right arete on the first buttress west of Treasure of the Sierra Madre.  A serious lead on easier terrain and a very nice line.
content.protection: Two bolts protect the arete, the first about 35 feet up and the second about 30 feet above that.  Harder climbing right above each bolt then easing.  Smaller aliens and sling for horn tie-off for some gear way above the second bolt.  Gear anchor medium cams.
content.location: Walk off north east then down gully near Pleasure Principal.  Faces southwest.

content.description: Stem up the wall behind you to reach good loose holds on a short steep wall - step right soon after the second bolt to the easy loose arete and a large ledge.
content.protection: Two bolts.  Small to medium cams for belay.
content.location: This route is in the corridor two buttresses east of Treasure of the Sierra Madre and faces north, opposite of Slap and Tickle and just left of The Macho Combo.

content.description: An offwidth in a dihedral (crux) leads to easier crack climbing and then the top.
content.protection: We used gear up through a #4 friend.  A somewhat larger piece (e.g. old style #4 Camalot) might be useful.
content.location: This is on the right side of the rightmost narrow formation.

content.description: Follow a crack system to the top.  The first half has some tricky moves in somewhat dirty rock.  The dihedral in the upper half is unpleasantly loose.
content.location: Cirque of the Climbables has a wide formation at its right end, and then five narrow formations farther left.  This climb is in the gully between the left two formations.

climbs.name: The Macho Combo
climbs.fa: Jack Marshall, Todd Battey and Dave Evans

content.description: This west facing route is adjacent to a large yucca plant. Accessing the first two bolts requires difficult moves (crux) above the yucca. A fall below the second bolt would leave you impaled on the "Spanish bayonet" (stick clipping is an option). Continue past one more bolt and horizontals to a large ledge. Fun but short (2 out of 5 stars).
content.protection: QD's for three bolts plus a few small TCU's for horizontals. Medium / Large cams and a lengthy cordelette are necessary for an anchor. Descent is a walk off.

climbs.name: Labyrinth
climbs.fa: Dave Evans, Todd Gordon, Hamish Morrison, Kevin Powell and Mike Rodrique, January 1990

climbs.name: Glue Rhymes with Poo
climbs.fa: Dave Evans, Todd Gordon, Margie Floyd (Evans), Hamish Morrison & Mike Rodrique, January 1990

content.description: A fun and varied line, and the longest at the Cirque. Starting in a small corner just left of the toe of the long buttress containing "Soup Rhymes with Poop" 5.8, climb up and then left to a prominent black left-leaning crack system. Good gear protects a few cruxy sections in the crack, which then leads to runout but easier face climbing to the top.
content.protection: Standard rack plus many long slings
content.location: The leftmost route at the Cirque. Begins about 20' left of long buttress containing "Soup Rhymes with Poop" 5.8. Descend by scrambling down one of several gullies/chimneys to either side.

pathTokens: Cirque of the Climbables - Left Side
